title: Champion Mastery Levels 6 and 7 live now!

replies.body:

So many leveling systems are meaningless when a high rank doesn't actually mean "plays well", it really just means "plays a lot".

I agree with this completely. The way it is now, you Literally need to purchase your mastery with essence that cant even be earned with that champ (because you wont earn any chests while playing that champ), which makes no sense.
It makes perfect sense.It is another money sink.

Definitely not what this is.... They don't need to "trick" their players in to wanting to buy these new things, but for those who are already customers and are willing to pay instead of wait (like some YouTubers like to do to get the "first look" at something) it makes it more accessible.

with that said lets call it 

" definitely not a riot trick"

ba dum tss
they said at the bottom that they are planning to implement a way to get the champ shard with ip or rp so you can get it with all the spare ip we have laying around

I think should be lowered to A. I've had a lot of amazing games on my support champ, Nami. 3/1/20 is a pretty good score, and only because of that one death did I get an A+. One thing They could also do instead is you have to earn S's and, at the same time, have a set amount of Mastery Points. 50k for Level 6 with S's and maybe 75k or 100k for 7 and a certain amount of S's. They should throw out the essence needed, you can't buy it and since you most likely earned your chest for your champ, you have to use another champ (which shouldnt affect your level) to get the essence. It's ridiculous they didn't think this through.
Clearly grades are not based solely on KDA.  It would be nice if they gave some general guidance as to how grades are determined though.  It might help everyone get better!
Exactly.  Any guidelines would be helpful.  I cant tell you how frustrating it is to get an A or A+ when I just went 9/1/12 as Garen top or 2/1/15 as Blitzcrank support.

Grades are percentile based, meaning it compares your overall score with the average overall score for your champ in your role in your elo. Your overall score is determined from your Kills, Assists, Deaths, CS, Objective Participation, Wards Placed, Wards Destroyed, and Gold Earned. It also takes into consideration how well your teammates did that particular game. So if you are Support Soraka and you do much better than the average Support Soraka in your elo than you would get an S however if your entire team does exceedingly well then your grade will be lowered. So it is possible to go 15/1/45 and still get an A if everyone on your team had a similar score or better. I know that might be a little confusing but I hope I helped a little bit.
I just had a game where i went Nasus top 13/1/5 with 368 CS against a teemo and got an A+. I dont care what you say there is no way that many Nasus players do that consistently at my elo
I feel you. As a Soraka main, going 2/1/20 is pretty darn great. Had 60k in healing. Apparently that only warrants an A-.

They say its based on the top players, but isn't that objective? Aren't they still deciding what those players do that weighs more? Would it kill them to give us even some general guidelines with some math behind it? Not to mention it usually dicks over tanky players since it seems to require way more cs than reasonable. Often as tanky jungler i have to build a titanic hydra just to get an S even when its not really something that character should build. Not to mention it doesn't really reward you for tanking damage and saving your teammates which is the tanks frikin job.
I actually recently had a LeBlanc game where I went like 19/0/7 or something like that, deathless, and I only got like an A+. Maybe my cs wasn't as good as it could be, but like, dang, yknow?
yes, ive gotten A, A- on sup champs, its so hard to get an S on supports, i finally got an S- on my Sona today going 6/4/25 and being really aggressive and roaming.

It's Riots way of dealing with excess champion shards in hextech chests.
A not satisfying and over complicated process just to BM.
It's just another way for Riot to suck money out of people
I totally agree with this. They're making it way to complicated.
Agreed.

This feels like Riot is trying to force relavence of champion shards by hampering the relavence of the Champion Mastery system. I really hate that Champion Mastery now relies on RNG/RP/IP purchases. That doesn't make sense. Why do I need to spend some resource to show that I'm good at something?

It was something that they put out because people were complaining that they had nothing to do with those champion shards.  Why do you need to spend some resource to show that I'm good at something?  Why do you need a mastery level to show you're good at something to begin with?

They can introduce a system to convert orange into blue and blue into orange essence and they can make it so its not exactly 1-to-1 ratio to combat abuse. Adding RNG and resource into obtaining mastery makes that mastery mean nothing. RIOT should make mastery lvl 6 or atleast lvl 7 a pure skill requirement like certain number of S+ or 5 penta kills in ranked or something along those lines. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In response to people asking me the same question over and over again here is my other comment I wrote in reply to the whole support and tank penta kill issue:

My argument was to make it purely skill based and that clearly doesn't mean just penta kills or S ranks, those were just examples. I meant it in terms of some achievement that applies to a specific champion or a group of champions. Say for example to get mastery lvl 7 with ezreal it could be to hit x number of consecutive mystic shots on champions. I know people spam qwe to stack tear and its counter productive but I'm sure the people at RIOT can come up with requirements that doesn't negatively affect game play.

Like requiring 3 mastery tokens to get Mastery 7 when you only get Mastery Tokens on S or S+ ranks (see bottom)?  Or are S ranks (not S+) too easy to get?  Also, if you actually read the article, you'll understand that they know about the RNG aspect. "Because loot has some RNG elements to finding champ shards and permanents, we’re working on a way to pick up only champ shards for IP or RP. "  

I disagree entirely on the mastery meaning nothing.  You still need the skill to get S ranks on the champion.  It's just additionally harder because you rely on RNG to get the champion shards you need.  Doesn't make it mean less.  Just that some people 'might deserve it' but haven't gotten it yet.  That feels like means more to me.

As for the penta kill idea, I'm guessing you do not play support or tank champs.  It needs to be an idea that is accessible to every champion in the game.  Pretty sure you'd tilt your team and carries if you steal a penta kill as the support (not to mention you don't build damage anyway so GETTING those kills will be rough).

******

Earn an S or higher in a champ mastery-enabled queue with that champ, unlocking a new Mastery token for that specific champ
Combine 3 Mastery tokens with a champ shard of the same champ, OR the champ permanent of the same champ, OR 600 blue essence, to unlock Level 7 (copied from the article)

Except that an S rank does not indicate skill with a champion.

In fact the S rank picks up people who are skilled at the game, but actually means very little about how good or bad they are with that specific champion. Whether or not your showcase of ability in the game will translate across the stats the algorithm looks at to determine your rank is pretty much just as much RNG as the Hextech Boxes.

lol ok, according to you then, people who are good at the game, and are able to perform better on a champion than others... Are not good at that champion.  Good differentiation.  Thanks.  Because I totally want the CPU bog down for recording if a Riven main can easily perform the AA animation interrupts because that's what matters.  Not how much you can turn your skill towards kills, warding, objective control, and winning the game.  But very specific mechanics.  I can only assume then because that is what's left.
.. That's not what we wanted Riot. Using blue essence to unlock a Mastery token doesn't show us how skilled we are with said champion. Just saying.

Truthfully, Level 7 is pretty hard to achieve unless you are extremely good with that champion. 3 S or S+ ranks are easier and easier to get the more games you have, but they are still hard accomplishments. I normally get S- on Bard 3/4 of my games, but I have gotten S or S+ maybe 10 out of my 100+ games with the system. I currently have 6 (in fact I got it in 3 games,) but 7 has given me trouble even though I have the essence for it.

Its not hard at all. Getting an S rating is easy if  you know the difference between an A+ and S-. Ive played certain champions so many games that I know what rank I have even b4 the game ends. So I get about 5 S games every 8-9 games.

I'm not talking about S-, I'm talking about S and S+. Which, as a support main, requires me to not die for my team during fights (that I'm normally in the middle of getting targeted due to my early game dominance as Bard) while still getting kills. Assists are the easy part, unless the game ends early. In that case, I normally don't have the assists to obtain an S, or S+ rank. So I have to get the kills that game to make that part high enough, which then makes my experience horrible cause people berate me for taking kills and still getting targeted so I have to be careful for not dying and ruining my kda. I get S- almost every game, but that step up to S feels extremely hard as I win over 60% of my Bard games but still rarely get S or S+. Does that mean if I make that step up I'll win over 70? 80? nearly 100?

I dont know if i'm playing league of legends to have fun or to collect farm mastery points anymore.
This system is way to complex, I would have been happier just with points or S rating...
Hextech shards is very unnecessary was to dump champion shards for those who own all champions.

Why in the world would you attach this new mastery system to having to have a champion shard of the same type? I know you're implementing a new way to get specific champ shards in the next couple of patches, but come on. I don't want to have to pay to be able to get a new emblem simply because I don't have the luck to be able to get the shard. It feels like you're trying to cram this new thing down our throats. It was fine to start out with and I was like "Oh, this is cool!" But limiting the mastery that we can get by adding extreme RNG/ a paywall is a step in the wrong direction. Make it to where we can still get the mastery for free WITHOUT the skin shards, but have it require more tokens or something. I'm fine with having to have 6 S- tokens instead of just two. Gives me a chance to TRULY prove that I deserve the mastery. It makes sense to add a sense of challenge to getting higher mastery, but don't put it behind  RNG/ a paywall. Heck, I'd even go far as to say that those who want it for free can even power through a full 10 tokens for mastery 6 and 20 for mastery 7. Those who have truly mastered the champion will be able to do it. Some may think that 10/20 is too much, but honestly these new ranks should be the ULTIMATE challenge of skill and teamwork. All I want is a shiny new emblem above my {{champion:432}} ...

I think the main issue here is that the Champion Mastery system really focuses on playing one or a few champions a lot, and being skilled at those Champions, while the Hextech Crafting system focuses a lot on playing many different Champions, since you can only get one free chest per Champion each season.

Basically, let's say I want to get my Mastery Level 7 on Vel'Koz. So I play a lot of Vel'Koz until I hit Level 5. I get one free chest for getting an S with him, and maybe I got a couple of key fragments along the way. Now all the sudden, if I wanna keep showing people that I'm reaching higher and higher mastery levels, I need to go play other champions to get chests with them and hope that I get a Vel'Koz shards or enough random Champion shards so that I can get my Level 6 and 7.

So I think the real problem here is: why should I have to play random other champions to show that I'm good at Vel'Koz?

Riot please fix the Champion Mastery system and fulfill the promise your made to the players to have a system to genuinely rewards skill and dedication.

Champion mastery is hands down the most exciting feature I have seen introduced to the game in the past two years I have been playing, but it has completely fallen short of the promise that was made.

Champion mastery points seem to stop mattering after 20 thousand. I've got almost 350k mastery points with Graves and yet I feel as though I need to be messing around with the hextech crafting system to be able to have this recognized.

These two system should be completely independent. The moment that "paid" translates to "mastery" (even if only cosmetically) League of Legends has begun to lose its integrity.
So, I can't get Mastery 7, nor 6 for my {{champion:37}} unless I give money to get chests... Okay. I guess getting S and S+ is just a waste of my time then...
